file_content.text: It's a pleasure to meet you, my lord.
Not far from where you were born, I think.
You are the slime, the filth, the wretches of society. You are what Sith Lords scrape off their boots.
Maybe you'll be lucky enough to crawl out of that muck and make something of yourselves. More likely, you'll die.
It's my job to see that it's one or the other.
Ah, Harkun, how good to see you again.
My old friend.
My lord, it's always a pleasure to see you.
I don't know why the Sith Empire even bothers with you. Miserable curs.
They'd be wiser to give you shovels and have you dig your own graves.
Ah, Harkun, good to see you haven't changed one bit.
Still the same jerk.
Well, well, my lord. I certainly never expected to see you again.
I take it these are the new acolytes.
A new group, I see.
My lord. You clean up well. Yes, these are the acolytes--a worse bunch than yours if you ask me.
Ahem.
Apologies, my lord. I didn't notice you there.
I was just preparing these new slaves for their imminent death.
Are you here for an apprentice, or were you just feeling nostalgic?
Darth Thanaton killed my last two apprentices.
I need a new apprentice.
Yes, I'd heard about that. They were incompetents anyway. Not that this group looks much better.
I'm certainly not here to see you.
Nostalgia? Don't kid yourself.
Still as prickly and arrogant as ever, eh, slave? I mean, my lord.
I was just thinking of what good times we had together. Well, that and my apprentices were just ruthlessly killed.
I missed you, sort of.
Good times. Yes. Heh.
Thanaton had the sense to pass up this cancerous lot, so they're yours if you want them.
This worm is Seferiss. They found him in a Hutt's palace, crushing prisoners' heads for the Hutt's entertainment.
Shut up, slave. You don't talk directly to a Lord of the Sith unless he asks it.
Shut up, slave. You don't talk directly to a Lord of the Sith unless she asks it.
This beady-eyed monstrosity is Argog. Don't know where on a kath hound's backside he's supposed to come from.
Sorry, what was that? Can't understand a word it says.
This gangly creature is Jaxun. He's no Sith, but he's at least human. No offense.
This gangly creature is Jaxun. He's no Sith, but he's at least human.
And this bone-faced one. Well, I can't pronounce whatever gibberish he says he's called. We call him Xalek.
Master.
Don't let him fool you. Too wild for his own good. There were two others, but we made the mistake of leaving them alone with Xalek.
I look forward to seeing the results of your trials. I trust you'll be a fair judge.
Thank you.
No one's ever had trouble from me they didn't deserve, my lord.
Make sure you push them as hard as you pushed me.
Be tough on them.
And look how you turned out. Murdered your master. Be careful what you wish for.
I caution you against choosing favorites, Harkun. I will check in often.
Don't try to pull anything.
You may check back as you please. I don't expect it to take too long to chew through this bunch.
What are you staring at, wretches? You know your trial. Now, go!
